intro: Echinospermum lappula, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a dry, dehiscent pod that splits open to release the seeds. The species is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
